results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Dead Air (Series 02. Ep. 11)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Millar, Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description: There’s a new wireless in the Fisher household – but there’s murder on the airwaves when Dot’s new favourite show is interrupted by an on air panic. The radio station’s bookkeeper and budding announcer is found choked to death but when Phryne gets involved, she finds Jack already undercover as the newsreader. In an ironic turnaround, Phryne is officially engaged to investigate the death - as Jack resorts to more clandestine investigative strategies. In the cut and thrust of the investigation, Dot suffers the terrible realisation that she doesn’t want to relinquish working for Miss Fisher when she marries and takes up her wifely duties. [Source: Every Cloud Productions]

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Murder on the Ballarat train  (Series 01. Ep. 02)
results.creator_credit: Kate Dennis, Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description: The glamorous Phryne Fisher (Essie Davis), accompanied by her maid Dot, decide to travel to the country by train to collect her new Hispano-Suiza motor car.The charm of rail travel soon evaporates though, when Phryne unexpectedly has to use her trusty pearl-handled pistol to save a young woman’s life and solve the disappearance of her fellow passenger’s mother. Her train trip derailed by a gruesome murder, Phryne speeds home in her Hispano-Suiza to her new abode in St Kilda where she works through the clues until she discovers her unassuming murderer. [Source: Every Cloud Productions]

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Cocaine Blues (Series 01. Ep. 01)
results.creator_credit: Tony Tilse, Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description: The Honourable Miss Phryne Fisher disembarks the Orient at Victoria Dock, returning to Melbourne after years abroad. Almost as soon as she checks into the Windsor Hotel, Phryne is embroiled in mystery: poisoned husbands, cocaine smuggling rings and illegal abortionists – not to mention erotic encounters with the handsome Russian dancer, Sasha de Lisse. Her adventure reaches its steamy end in the Turkish Bath Palace off Little Lonsdale Street. [Source: Every Cloud Productions]

results.title: La Mia Vita = My Life
results.brief_description: An elderly Italian man decides to look through his photo album. This causes him to reflect on his life. From his youth, to his adolescence, through to his older years, the man looks back on the moments of his life that he treasures the most, and those that are very dear to his heart.

results.title: Ignatius Quince: the cautionary tale of a Child Genius
results.brief_description: Every year the school held a science fair. Ignatius Quince, being the child genius he was, had won it for the last 5 years. This year was to be no exception. Ignatius Quince was going to build the most stupendous experiment. However plans don’t always run smoothly and Ignatius Quince gets a hand from a most unexpected person, Mable Syrup.

results.title: In the air is Christopher Gray
results.brief_description:
A series of unfortunate events leads to disaster when young Christopher Gray tries to impress the girl of his dreams.
Written, directed and animated by Felix Massie.
Cast: Andy London, Peter Ahern, Justin Cassano, Carolyn London, Ian Miller, Erica Perez
Soundtrack: Joe Paine
Sound design and mix: Marty O’Brien

results.title: I am Tom Moody
results.brief_description:
As the performer steps up to the microphone, will the desire to make music be defeated by fears of failure and feelings of inadequacy? The awful solitude of the spotlight forces Tom to confront his inner critic.
Written, directed and animated by Ainslie Henderson.
Voices: Mackenzie Crook, Jude Crook, Rick Webster
Music: Peter Deane
Compositing: Will Anderson
Sound design: Ainslie Henderson, Joe Acheson

results.title: Holy She*p
results.creator_credit: Magnus Kravik, Katerina Pantela and Arts University Bournemouth
results.brief_description:
Pursued by a nun with a shearing blade, a sheep tries frantically to escape. Does the cruise ship visiting his island hold a hope of sybaritic freedom? Perhaps, but not in quite the way our protagonist dreams.
Story and animation: Parina Mehta, Katerina Pantela, Magnus Kravik
Layout, background and design: Heather Vogel, Katerina Pantela
Assistant animators: Mengly Li, Dominic Elsey
Editors: Carl Reader, Thorbjorn Munter
Music and sound design: Daniel Weismayr

results.title: The Mansion [game trailer]
results.brief_description: It’s a moonless night… Let’s go explore a mansion. In ‘The Mansion’, a nameless character finds himself with the task of searching an old mansion. Although he can’t understand the lost children it doesn’t take a true connection to know only he can help. The story is told through a platformer format, inspired by games such as Super Mario Bros.

results.title: My City Walkabout
results.creator_credit: Emmie Seaton, Mateuse Pingol and MatEm Productions
results.brief_description: ‘My City Walkabout’ is a film with a French New Wave aesthetic that follows an Aboriginal man searching for his place in modern Australian society. Set in the man’s dream, the film explores magic realism sequences to illustrate the protagonist’s desire to alter his reality and ultimately find his identity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Emmie Seaton, Mateuse Pingol and MatEm Productions
